$eref.description: Identifies a property.

___code.description: Uniquely identifies a single property for a reservation.

___name.description: Specifies the proper name of the property.

___brandCode.description: Identifies a brand with in a chain (e.g. Courtyard, Hampton Inn).  This code is optional if the hotel is an independent property that can be identified by a propert code alone.

___chainName.description: Specifies the proper name of the chain.

___cityCode.description: Specifies the three character IATA city code.

___brandName.description: Identifies the proper name of the brand.

___count.description: Number available for sale or that have been sold

___name.description: Display name for this product.  EG "First Class"

A tiny string  
Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32

$eref.description: A product with a from price point.

___vendor.description: Specifies the vendor for this priced product.

___fromPrice.description: The starting price for this product.

___Product.description: The product that this pricing refers to.

$eref.description: A product with a from price point.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description: Specifies the details of a room rate.

___effectiveDate.description: Specifies the starting date for this room rate.

___expireDateExclusiveInd.description: When true, the ExpireDate is the first day after the applicable period (e.g. when expire date is Oct 15  the last date of the period is Oct 14).

___expireDate.description: Specifies the end date for this room rate.

___Rate2.description: Specifies the rate for the room.

___promotionCode.description: Identifyies host to link directly with a specific named advertising campaign. By including the code, the client is able to gain access to special offers which MAY have been created for a specifically targeted group via a CRM system or for a wider advertising campaign using Television or press adverts.

___ratePlanCode.description: Specifies the rate plan code for the product.

___roomTypeCode.description: Specifies the system room type code (ex: A1K, A1Q).

$eref.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___company.description: Name of the company that manages the reference system.

___url.description: Uri of the creating system. The URI should be an URL and be globally unique. Should only be omitted when the context is clearly implied for the containing document.

___instance.description: The identification of a record as it exists at a point in time. An instance is used in update messages where the sender must assure the server that the update sent refers to the most recent modification level of the object being updated.

___system.description: Name or identifier for the creating system.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

$eref.description: Base type for SOAP request messages.

XSD DateTime allows either a time-zone specification or allows the time-zone to be omitted. 
When omitted, times are "local". XSD DateTime with either a "Z" or a "+/-hh:mm" value are UTC. Time is the time "in the indicated time zone". When a element or attribute has xsd:dateTime type, the data in a message can be either local or UTC and software can easily determine which it is.

___departureDate.description: Specifies the departure date for the query.

$eref.description:
XSD DateTime allows either a time-zone specification or allows the time-zone to be omitted. 
When omitted, times are "local". XSD DateTime with either a "Z" or a "+/-hh:mm" value are UTC. Time is the time "in the indicated time zone". When a element or attribute has xsd:dateTime type, the data in a message can be either local or UTC and software can easily determine which it is.

$eref.description: Base type for SOAP response messages.

___Status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the Status_Enum(NotProcessed | Incomplete | Complete | Unknown) however, the data type is designated an open enumeration, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

___Result.description: When present indicates that errors or warnings occurred during processing.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___Product.description: The product that this pricing refers to.

_88PricedProduct.description: A product with a from price point.
